abstract: The California Public Employees’ Retirement System, the largest public pension fund in the United States, put $400 million in a Pacific Corporate Group investment unit focused on developing countries. The unit, PCG International, will invest the money in private equity funds in international markets including Japan, China, India, Central Europe, Latin America and Africa, the company said.
lead_paragraph: The California Public Employees’ Retirement System, the largest public pension fund in the United States, put $400 million in a Pacific Corporate Group investment unit focused on developing countries. The unit, PCG International, will invest the money in private equity funds in international markets including Japan, China, India, Central Europe, Latin America and Africa, the company said.

headline.main: Calpers Puts $400 Million in Private Equity Fund’s Coffers
